docs.title: uv for PyCharm user documentation
docs.text:
This site serves as the user documentation for the uv for PyCharm plugin, a plugin that aims to maps the various functionalities of uv to PyCharm's.

It only supports the latest version of uv and can be installed on PyCharm 2024.1 and later.

docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text: This project is not an official Astral project.

docs.title: uv: Sync
docs.text:
It might be helpful if you don't want to use the corresponding intention for some reasons.

Note

Unlike the intention, this action does not save unsaved files.

docs.title: What does this plugin do?
docs.text:
It allows you to invoke uv's functionalities via PyCharm's. It interacts with the executable on your behalf. It saves you the unnecessary efforts of typing the same commands again and again.

It also provides some aesthetic features, such as customized icons for uv.lock and uv.toml files.

docs.title: Is this an official Astral project?
docs.text:
No. However:

  • Astral was made aware of it during to its development, and
  • It is meant to serve as the first step towards an "official" plugin.

docs.title: Generating new project
docs.text: In the New Project dialog, there will be an uv option on the left column.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text: Due to technical limitations, it is not possible to extend the standard panel. While the custom panel for uv should have the same basic functionalities, you cannot use it with other frameworks.

docs.title: uv.lock should not be edited manually
docs.text: Shows an editor-level notice when uv.lock is edited.

docs.title: Run uv sync
docs.text:
This intention is available everywhere in the pyproject.toml and uv.lock files.

When triggered, it will also save pyproject.toml if necessary.

docs.title: Managing packages
docs.text: When you use the Python Packages toolwindow, install, uninstall and upgrade operations will invoke uv's corresponding commands instead of pip's.

docs.title: File icons
docs.text: In the Project tool window, the icons for uv.lock and uv.toml files are replaced with uv logos.
